definition: right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Though never rebellious, he sometimes bristled at being given too many directions.
sentences.chinese: 雖然從不叛逆，但有時，他會對過多的命令發怒。

sentences.english: He indicingestedd the bar down the street when I asked where his father was.
sentences.chinese: 我問他爸爸在哪裏的時候他指了指街道對過的酒吧。

sentences.english: This feature eliminates the need for a separate temperature sensor for over-temperature monitoring.
sentences.chinese: 此功能消除了對過單獨的溫度傳感器溫度監測的需要。

sentences.english: I am here, not over there.
The fundamental problem with 50-year political predictions is that virtually no-one gets them right.
sentences.chinese: 50年政治預測根本的問題是，幾乎沒人說對過。

sentences.english: Is the new building across the street for commercial use?
sentences.chinese: 街道對過那幢新樓是商用樓嗎？

sentences.english: As a primary purpose, the effect of angle of attack and height of spoiler on the unsteady flows are investigated.
sentences.chinese: 着重探討了來流攻角和擾流片高度對過沖量的影響。

sentences.english: I think so, I set it by the radio this morning.
sentences.chinese: 我想是準的，今天早上我把表跟收音機的報時對過了。

sentences.english: Will you do me the favor of moving this couch to the other side of the room?
sentences.chinese: 你願幫我把這張長沙發移到房子對過的那一邊嗎？

sentences.english: The bus stop is just across the street.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽車站就在街對過。
